direct_answer.text: First let’s calculate the purchase amount made by Mr. Rogers when buying this expensive wristwatch during sales event. It means we need to find out what would be the new selling cost if the item costs only Rs 75%. Therefore our equation becomes Price= (Percentage/100) X Original Cost i.e., Sale_Price=((percent)/(100))*OriginalCost which equals ((75/100)*Rs 5081959)= Rs 3811469. This indicates that while purchasing the luxury timepiece as part of clearance promotion, Mr. Rogers paid lesser than half of its actual value because initially the product was being offered at just one quarter off! \[ \text{Purchase Price} = \$5,081,959 \times 0.75 = \$3,811,469.25 \]

Simplifying further leads us to find out SP which equals \($5081959*(0.75)*(1.2)\), resulting in \$4571369.3 as sales revenue or sell price received.
ost_step.3: Lastly, since we know both prices ($5081959 &$4571369.3 ), we calculate the percent decrease using [(Original Price – Final Sales Revenue)/ Original Price]*100%. 1.subquestion: At what price did Mr. Rogers purchase the watch (as an absolute value)?

subanswer.text: To find out at what price Mr. Rogers purchased the watch, calculate 75% of the original price, i.e., 0.75 x $5081959 = $3811469.75. The answer is approximately $3811469.75 when rounded up or down depending upon convention used but since you asked for number not decimal representation hence considering whole numbers here would be appropriate . Answer :$3811470.

2.subquestion: Now let us determine Sale Price Which will later help us get Discount %. Here Let TP= Original Price=$5081959 SP_Roger=------->SP_Friend=(TP*120)/100 Where , SP_Friend=$(($5081959)*(120))/(100)=$6098350 Hence now Total Markdown achieved By Friend Is=>MarkDown %=[(OriginalPrice–Sellingprice)]×100%= [(TOP – SPFRIEND) ] × 10

subanswer.text:
To calculate the markdown percent acquired by Friends you need firstly find out what Roger purchased this Watch which means we can use below formula:-
Sales/Retail Price (What rogers paid)? => Purchased Amount (Aftermarking offdisc.)==>[((TotalCost*(DesiredDiscountPercentageOfProduct))] /[(100+DesiredDiscountPercentage)] == [($5081959 * (1-(75/100))))]/$1.75 ===[$5081959*$25]/[$1.75=== ($25*5081959)/$1.75]====>≈=$7283947.14Now Next Step Findout Sales amount Bought Too Much Of It!!--->>>>>So-----How Many Percent Off Was Done!!!<<<------>Here We Can Use Below Formula :-ActualAmountBoughtByYouAtFirstPlace <= ActualFinalPaidForThisItemInReturn !![]//<= Final Paid AtLastStep But Not Equal As You Must Have Filed With!We Know Both Side Values Are Known And
